properties.name: Airport Fields - aka Gravelly Point
properties.description: Posted by SpacebasDriving Directions First, get to George Washington Parkway. then: * From South of the Airport: Heading north on GW Parkway (from Alexandria), Gravelly Point is the first exit after (and it is immediately after) National Airport. * From North of the Airport: You can only get to Gravelly Point from a northbound exit from GW Parkway. And so, from the North, heading southbound, you need to go past Gravelly point, and turn around (which is not as bad as it sounds). Two options are: (a) take the Airport exit and follow signs to Terminal C, and then signs for GW Parkway North (b) continue on GW south until you reach Daingerfield Island, where you can turn around and head north Option (a) is faster, though option (b) is a little more straight-forward. Bike Directions From the Mall: * From the mall, head towards the Lincoln memorial * Cross Memorial bridge on the left side * Follow trail as it curves back towards the river. (veer left -make u-shape - don\'t go straight) * Cross PedX crosswalk over GW pkwy. * Take a right on GW trail (south) towards National Airport * Bike until you see the Airport fields on your right * if you bike alongside the National Airport runway (on your left biking south) you have gone too far!

properties.name: Anacostia Fields
properties.description: Posted by SpacebasDriving Directions # From Virginia: Take 395 N towards the 14th St Bridge. Once on the Bridge, stay in one of the three right lanes (the left-most lane will take you to 14th St.) After crossing the bridge and getting on to what is called the Southwest-Southeast Freeway, stay in one of the two left lanes -- do not stay in the right lanes, even though some signs indicate you need to exit to remain on 395 North. Instead, follow the signs that take you to Pennsylvania Ave (one of the last exits). Take the exit and you will cross over the Sousa Bridge. Once over the river, make the first right, immediately after crossing the railroad tracks, onto Fairlawn. Take the next right into the park (and back over the tracks) and at the river make a right (which takes you under the bridge). Park in the lot at the Pavilion. # From DC: Take Penn. Ave east and follow directions above from Sousa Bridge. # From Maryland: Use the DC directions, or take 295 S to Penn Ave East and turn right onto Fairlawn. Follow the directions above. Bike Directions (From Central DC): * Get on Penn Ave, heading South and East, just east of the Capital * Stay on Penn Ave through many intersections until you come to the Penn Ave/Sousa Bridge * Cross Penn Ave to the north side (wherever you see it is safe--you could cross one light before the bridge and then bike the sidewalk, against traffic, until you hit the bridge) * Get to the Bike Route (you may see a small green sign marking this bike route), which does a curve north, then south through a small green grassy area before it enters the north side of the Sousa Bridge via the pedestrian walkway * Bike, or walk your bike, over the Penn Ave/Sousa Bridge to the other side * Stay on the bike path, taking the first left, down the embankment and towards the Anacostia River (you will see the open-air, concrete monstrousity, Roller Skate Pavillion ahead) * At the bottom of the embankment, take a right towards the Pavillion and the fields are on your right, south of the Pavillion

properties.name: Bluemont Fields
properties.description: Posted by SpacebasBluemont Park is just off of Wilson Blvd (near the corner of Wilson and Manchester), just west of Glebe Rd, near the I-66/Glebe Rd exit. Park in the North Parking Lot, which is near the tennis courts, and near the corner of Wilson and Manchester. The park can also be accessed from Rte 50. If heading out of DC, take 50 West and make a right on N. Manchester Street. The entrance to the south parking lot will be on the right. Note: this lot gets locked at sunset (usually). To access the north lot from Rte-50 you will need to zig zag through the neighborhood (Manchester does not go through). Continue on Manchester until it dead ends and make a left on 4th STREET. This road dead ends on Montague. Make a right on Montague St and then a right onto 4th ROAD, which dead ends on the other side of Manchester. Make a left on Manchester and the parking lot will be on the right. Bike Directions - from the Mall (courtesy of Lisa Berman) The Bluemont fields are completely bike accessible - plan on it taking 35 - 40 minutes to Bluemont from the Mall area and about 45 - 50 back to Adams Morgan. * From the mall, head towards the Lincoln memorial. * Cross Memorial bridge on the left side. * Follow trail as it curves back towards the river. (veer left -make u-shape - don\'t go straight) * Cross PedX crosswalk over GW pkwy. * Take a left on GW trail (north) towards Rosslyn. * Go about 1.5 - 2 miles until Rosslyn. * After you climb the zig-zagging bridge (linking GW trail to Rosslyn) you will find yourself in Rosslyn at the corner of N. Lynn St. and Lee Hwy (29). * follow the other bikers on the sidewalk (this is on Lee Hwy) until the trail picks up again (about 2 blocks; sidewalk turns to pavement). * Basically you are going to parallel 66 for about 5 miles. * Stay left and follow the "Custis Trail" (there will be many exits to side streets in Arlington) * You will take one sharp left turn on a bike-overpass over 66 before Glebe Rd. If you hit Glebe, turn-around and make a sharp right turn. * Follow path until it intersects with the W&OD trail. * Take a left here and go approx. 1.5 miles until you reach Bluemont. * You are very close when you go through an underpass (under Wilson Blvd.) * The fields should be on the right after you emerge, just past the Tennis courts. * If you stray into a wooded area and see a Frisbee Golf course, you have just passed the fields, so turn around. You can also access the Curtis bike trail coming from Georgetown: * Take Key Bridge to VA, stay on right side. * Take a right at second light onto Lee Hwy (29). * This becomes the Custis Trail If you plan to take the trail home... (Bluemont to Dupont Circle, Adams Morgan, Mt. Pleasant, etc.) I would: * take the Key bridge into Georgetown * take left at intersection of N. Lynn and Lee Hwy (29) * Cross Key on the right side * Merge with traffic and take a left onto 33rd St. * Take a Right on P St. * Follow P until you see the right exit for the Rock Creek Pkwy (just before Dupont Circle) * Take Right exit (yes you are going against traffic!) * Take a left and pick up Rock Creek Pkwy trail! Enjoy! It is a great ride with MANY HILLS!

properties.name: Francis Scott Key Middle School - aka Key Fields
properties.description: Posted by Spacebas Key Fields Address is 910 Schindler Drive in Silver Spring Take the Beltway or 16th street (from DC) to Maryland 29 north Colesville Road. If you are coming up 16th, 29 splits off right at the Maryland border. If you are on the Beltway, 29 is the exit just east of Georgia. Take 29 up to 650 (New Hampshire). Take New Hampshire south or east (it\'s diagonal, so I\'m not sure which they\'ll say). Go about a half mile and take a right onto Schindler Drive. It\'s a light and White Oak golf course is on your left. School is about three blocks down on your right. Three fields fit here easily. As you walk up the hill from the parking lot, fields #1 and #2 are on your right. They should be set up parallel to each other and running left to right with #1 in front and #2 in back. To the left is field #3. It should run front to back. Field 3 is on a slightly lower level.

properties.name: Lake Fairfax Park
properties.description: Posted by Spacebas  Lake Fairfax is located off of Baron Cameron Rd in Reston. Take route 7 north from the beltway, hang a left onto Baron Cameron in Reston, and then the park entrance is ahead on your left.

properties.name: Mall Fields
properties.description: Posted by Spacebas  The fields are on the Mall adjacent to (and about 100 yards south of) the Reflecting Pool, between the Lincoln Memorial and the Washington Monument. Bike Directions to the Mall from upper NW, DC and Georgetown: * Get onto the Rock Creek Bike Path, South * Take the Bike Path through the Virginia Street intersection (with the boat house in your right), past the Kennedy Center (on your left) * As the path forks to the left after the Kennedy Center, you can go either way: 1) shortest route, but crosses busy traffic 3-4 times * Stay alongside the river (on your right) going up to Memorial Bridge and the Lincoln Memorial * Cross this street to the left (north), the opposite direction as if you were going towards the Memorial bridge (go from one guarding lion statue to the other) * Continue crossing streets (with busy traffic in rush hour, so be careful!) until you\'ve made a half-circle, clockwise, around the Lincoln Memorial and you\'ve crossed the final street of traffic where you are now in a no-automobile area (now watch for pedestrians and other bikers!) * Bike towards the right side of the Reflecting Pool (south side), down the short hill/embankment and the fields are quickly on your right.

properties.name: Montgomery Hills Junior High School / Hebrew Academy
properties.description: Posted by Spacebas Former Montgomery Hills Junior High School / Hebrew Academy 2010 Linden Ln, Silver Spring, Montgomery County Take the Beltway to Georgia Ave and head south. Make a right on Seminary Road. (Not Seminary Place) Continue on Seminary Road for a block and a half. At the fork, veer left onto Linden Lane. Continue on Linden Lane for one block. At the fork, veer left onto Brookville Road. Almost immediately on the left is the entrance to the parking lot and the fields. The Montgomery Hills fields are .7 miles from the Forest Glen Metro. Fields are horizontal to the school & woods. There is room for two fields side-by-side. When two fields are scheduled, allow room for the 2nd game. When three games are scheduled, the third field would be adjacent to the tennis courts ( running from the tot lot to the edge of the hill) – tight but a field.

properties.name: Polo Fields
properties.description: Posted by SpacebasThe Polo Fields are located downtown next to the FDR Memorial and across Independance Ave. from the Lincoln Memorial.

properties.name: Sligo Middle School
properties.description: Posted by Spacebas Directions from the Beltway: * Take the Beltway (I-495) to * Georgia Avenue North * Go about one mile and turn * Right on Dennis Rd. * Pass one traffic light then turn * Left into the school parking lot Restrooms are in Sligo Park Ã‚Â½ mile from the fields. From Sligo Middle School parking lot, turn left (head east) on Dennis Ave. At the first stop sign, located at the bike trail in Sligo Creek Park, turn left. Restrooms are 100 yards on the left.

properties.name: Tilden Center
properties.description: Posted by SpacebasTilden Center 6300 Tilden Ln, Rockville, Montgomery County, Maryland Access to the site is from Old Georgetown Road. Going north on Old Georgetown, turn left onto Tilden Ln. Drive to the Tilden Center on Left. Turn left on Marcliff Rd to drive around back of bldg. Fields are not the baseball fields, but the fields the storage hut off to the side. When two fields are scheduled, they should be setup perpendicular to the slope of the hill/woods.

properties.name: Tilden Middle School
properties.description: Posted by Spacebas Tilden Middle School 11211 Old Georgetown Rd, Rockville, Montgomery County, Maryland Site is located 1/2 mile west of the intersection of Tuckerman (& the north spur of the beltway) and Old Georgetown roads. Fields are located below the "Stadium" field next to the tree line. We are not to play on the stadium field. When 2 fields are scheduled, the fields can be laid out horizontally to the slope of the hill. When 3 fields are scheduled, the fields are to be setup perpendicularly to the hill.
